Focus. #deliverThis is why I do what I do!I train and mentor clients who are interested in implementing agile software development processes (Scrum and others) AND, in general, work with teams -- no matter what industry -- in getting better at becoming more effective.  Most recently, I have been working with very small firms and some of the largest enterprise organizations that are rolling out various agile practices.I am interested in forging ahead with strategic partnerships and looking for people who are interested in investing in companies running in an agile manner  (because I am currently personally investing in projects and multiple joint ventures).  You can contact me today at mvizdos@vizdosenterprises.com.

As the ScrumMaster In Residence with the da Vinci Center at VCU,  I work with the team to teach -- and practice -- Agile and Scrum ideas at the graduate and undergraduate levels with students, faculty and staff.I am also an advocate for change within the University and our community.Focus.  #deliver

This is currently running out of Richmond, Virginia (my home base).  It is based on a concept started in Arizona about ten years ago.  For more information about this please visit www.gangplankrva.org, www.whatisgangplank.com, www.gangplankhq.com, or ping me.  This is in addition to my day job (read: complete VOLUNTEER).You can contact me today at mvizdos@vizdosenterprises.com.

Responsible for the Professional Services Organization and coaching clients on agile project management related issues.  Internationally publish, speak, and mentor on both agile and prescriptive methodologies.  Work with prospects during pre-sales opportunities to help identify resources on specific projects, close contracts, and communicate with clients throughout the different engagements around the world.Co-authored and published a book with Scott Ambler on the "Enterprise Unified Process" during this time.You can contact me today at mvizdos@vizdosenterprises.com.

Built a firm with two consulting divisions including traditional and prepaid services.  The traditional division focused on delivering services to large corporations that included: custom programming, project management, coaching, and business process re-engineering.  The prepaid division focused on delivering services to small and mid-size businesses that included an outsourced 24*7*365 fixed-price toll-free monthly help desk PC support package.  Sold the company and went to work full time with Ronin International (they were a client since September 11, 2001 -- good bar conversation today if you are interested!).You can contact me today at mvizdos@vizdosenterprises.com.
Completed my undergraduate work in three years.

I have been involved with this for over seven years (originally with the team in Chandler, Arizona) and am an active community builder and local mentor for the growing Entrepreneurship community in Richmond, Virginia.  You can learn more about me at www.michaelvizdos.com.

I am remiss and very tardy in writing this recommendation for Mike, who I owe so much in my agile journey.  Mike was my CST for the CSM and CSPO courses and has been an ongoing mentor of mine ever since; something that I am very grateful for.  Although Mike teaches the ceremonies and artifacts of scrum, it is his deep love of the agile principles that has had the greatest impact on me.  Mike is a true servant leader.

Owner at CrossFit Pushin Weight
December 14, 2007, Kara was a client of Michael’s

I worked with Mike over the period of a few years at a fortune 500 company where he worked as an Agile Coach. I feel like Mike is a great teacher. He leads and helps you along the way. He does not give you the answer out right, Mike asks questions to help you gain understanding on your own rather that feeding you the answers.  He has such great perspective and thoughts…most of this can be seen in Mike's wonderful website.  I was interested in being a certified Scrum Trainer at one point in time and Mike allowed me to observe a class that he was teaching. It really helped me to see what I wanted to be doing and to even check to see if being a certified trainer was something that I could do.  I do highly recommend Mike.  He gets Agile and People/Team management/motivation at a very deep level.

Michael Vizdos is recognized as a thought leader in Scrum and has made numerous contributions to the Agile community. Michael and Mark Pushinsky developed one of the most interesting and informative Certified Scrum Master courses available today. Michael's site implementingscrum.com is a gem of insights and humor, and demonstrates his deep understanding of the many issues Agile makes visible in organizations today. I highly recommend Michael Vizdos as an insightful Scrum trainer and as a consultant to give an independent perspective on your IT processes.

Zsolt and I first worked together almost 10 years ago (with Scott Ambler at that time).  Over the years, we have kept in touch.  Actually, a lot more than that.  Today, we are partners in joint ventures together and are working with various clients on an international basis.  In addition to working together in Hungary over the years, recently Zsolt has been with me to the USA and India working as a team to deliver *incredible* results to our customers.Our relationship over the years has grown out of mutual trust and respect.  He does what he says he will do, and encourages others to do the same.  He delivers consistent outstanding results.If you have any questions about Zsolt, please contact me directly and we can talk!Thank you.- mike vizdos

summary: ​My name is Michael Vizdos and I can improve internal business velocity within your organization.​I help you shape your development teams -- software and product -- into a business engine to drive consistent results faster and simpler.​Get beyond some book you read (probably only a few chapters) or conference learning your developers received.Get from concept to cash without the chaos.  Your job is to remove the chaos. ​Focus. #deliverI am an entrepreneur, innovator, author and Scrum Master in Residence at Virginia Commonwealth University.My services include consulting, training, and professional mentoring (www.MichaelVizdos.com).I am a Certified Scrum Trainer (with the Scrum Alliance) and Agile Coach / Mentor.I work with people (not "resources" or faceless organizations).Are you ready for a change? It starts with a conversation.  Let's talk.  You can contact me today at mvizdos@vizdosenterprises.com or www.michaelvizdos.com/contact.Thank you.- michael vizdos  Focus. #deliver  www.michaelvizdos.com  www.implementingscrum.com  www.agilementoring.com  www.iwantscrumtraining.com  www.scruminschool.org
